title: Old-Fashioned Potato Cakes Recipe
description: These potato cakes are super easy to make for a tasty side to any meal. If you've got leftover mashed potatoes ‚Äî they're ready in just 20 minutes!

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Side Dish Potato Pancakes Old-Fashioned Potato Cakes 4.4 (340) 287 Reviews 81 Photos These potato cakes are simple and quick to make with only a few ingredients. Great with any meal and kids of all ages love 'em! Submitted by DaMonkey Updated on September 23, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 81 81 81 81 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 10 mins Total Time: 20 mins Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 2 cups mashed potatoes 1 cup all-purpose flour 1 onion, diced 1 egg ¬Ω teaspoon ground black pepper ¬Ω teaspoon salt ¬Ω cup vegetable oil, or as needed Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Mix mashed potatoes, flour, onion, egg, black pepper, and salt in a bowl until well combined, similar to a batter consistency. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Heat vegetable oil in a skillet over medium heat. Drop 4-inch circles of batter into the hot oil. Cook until golden brown, about 4 to 5 minutes per side. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Drain on paper towels. Repeat with any remaining batter. Serve and enjoy! Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Editor's Note: We have determined the nutritional value of oil for frying based on a retention value of 10% after cooking. The exact amount will vary depending on cooking time and temperature, ingredient density, and the specific type of oil used. I Made It Print 731 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 255 Calories 5g Fat 45g Carbs 7g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 4 Calories 255 % Daily Value * Total Fat 5g 6% Saturated Fat 1g 6% Cholesterol 49mg 16% Sodium 627mg 27% Total Carbohydrate 45g 16% Dietary Fiber 3g 11% Total Sugars 3g Protein 7g 14% Vitamin C 9mg 10% Calcium 44mg 3% Iron 2mg 12% Potassium 407mg 9% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Old-Fashioned Potato Cakes 01 of 81 Photo by¬† Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 81 Photo by¬† TxCin2 12/16/2024 These were a nice way to use up some leftover mashed potatoes. My mom used to make potato pancakes with fresh shredded potatoes and onion, so I expected this to be similar, but it really isn't. These are slightly crisp on the very edges, soft in the center, and were firm and dense. I used dried minced onion and it worked fine. That amount of onion called for is way too much for me, so I cut back to a quarter called for, and these were still very oniony tasting. Even though I salted the mashed potatoes in the original dish, this calls for more salt and I skipped it thinking it wasn't necessary. It wasn't, but it would have been better with a little more salt added. They came out of the pan crisp, but lost some of it while sitting waiting to be served. The batter was super thick, and I was patient in placing a large dollop in the hot oil and then working gently with a silicone spatula, I spread them out to form semi circular shapes. These were better when dipped in gravy, but then everything's better with gravy in the south. This was a fast and easy dish from start to finish. 03 of 81 Photo by¬† Izcremguy 09/27/2024 Made 11 cakes using a blue handled ice cream scoop. 04 of 81 Photo by¬† Hollmart 07/08/2024 Easy and good I added chives to the mix ‚ù§Ô∏è 05 of 81 Photo by¬† PlushWhisk2173 07/01/2024 A keeper! Easy to follow Easy to prepare and cost affective. 06 of 81 Photo by¬† Lydia M Sturgill 06/25/2024 Family favorite Easy to follow Great flavors Worth the effort 07 of 81 Photo by¬† MsFaith Ferris 11/09/2023 What a quick and easy also yummy recipe. 08 of 81 Photo by¬† CopperHam6988 07/16/2023 Really tasty. I didn't use a whole onion but would next time. Also would increase the pepper and maybe add a smidge of something like cream cheese or sour cream to the mix (my mashed potatoes are pretty plain) but I thought these were really tasty and I enjoyed them very much. I ate them with a bit of sour cream. 09 of 81 Photo by¬† BriefChip7448 06/08/2023 Awesome way to use up left over mash,also added grated cheese.Totally delicious üëçüèªWould make them again,family loved them. 10 of 81 Photo by¬† Sabrina Smith 01/07/2023 FLOUR? WHY?! Made a thick/doughy cake. Not appetizing. Added more potatoes to remainder to "loosen " it. All in all, egg is enough. NO flour necessary. 1 2 3 4 5 Next You‚Äôll Also Love Corned Beef Potato Pancakes 27 Ratings Chef John's Classic Potato Pancakes 57 Ratings Easy Leftover Potato Pancakes 186 Ratings Leftover Mashed Potato Pancakes 25 Ratings Backyard Skillet Smashed Potatoes and Onions 4 Ratings Instant Potato Pancakes 86 Ratings Apple-Potato Latkes Baked Potato Latkes 31 Ratings My Crispy Mashed Potato Pancake 235 Ratings Potato Pancakes 307 Ratings Kay Dee's Recipe for Potato Latkes 29 Ratings Irish Boxty 115 Ratings Chorizo Latkes 4 Ratings Easy Potato Pancakes 165 Ratings Boxty 14 Ratings Air Fryer Latkes 5 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices ¬† Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith¬†publishing¬†family.
